ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Coming into the course, I was more of a short story writer and playwright than a poet, but after taking this course Im more comfortable with poetry and am even taking a poetry course next semester. I learned a good overview of the 3 units covered in the course and because the grades are sort of withheld until the end, I felt that I could focus on my creativity more without putting a number on it.

I learned an incredible amount from this course. First and foremost, the course is organized to allow students to reflect on their work. I learned to look at my writing differently. I also got the chance to experiment with different genres which I was unfamiliar with prior.
Learned about the techniques of creative writing. I did not just improve my writing skills, but learned how to do so, which was crucial for me.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: loved the structure of the course and meeting with other sections for the plenary lectures and guest lectures, the assignments were a fun creative challenge and didnt ask for too much, the workshops were fun and engaging and the students and professor all really cared about making each other better writers, the professor gives SO MUCH WONDERFUL FEEDBACKparagraphs for each assignment which is very kind of him
Weaknesses: Especially at the beginning of the course, the room felt a little tense and slightly uncomfortable to contribute ideas to classroom conversation, sometimes it felt like the feedback was a little close minded
The way the course is currently organized is rather strong in my opinion. No weaknesses. I believe that the small class size and how responsive the professor is are the greatest strengths.

There is no revision (except for the one workshopped piece) until the final unit submission. Since the class emphasizes the importance of revision, it would make sense to have more opportunities to revise certain assignments and get feedback multiple times, not just once.
Excellent choices of readings, good feedback from professor

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely because youll learn which aspects of creative writing are for you via this survey of 3 different forms of creative writing. And youll get to write often and workshop your work with really talented student writers
Yes. At any level of creative writing experience, you will have fun with this class.
